characters: ON THE REAR OF THE DECK
ON VARIOUS LOCATIONS ON THE AXIOM
BACK UP IN THE CAPTAIN'S QUARTERS
ON OTHER SIDE OF BOULDER CRATER

dialogues.speaker: FADE IN
dialogues.text: Stars. The upbeat show tune, Put On Your Sunday Clothes, plays. “Out there, there’s a world outside of Yonkers...” More stars. Distant galaxies, constellations, nebulas... A single planet. Drab and brown. Moving towards it. Pushing through its polluted atmosphere. “,..Close your eyes and see it glisten...” EXT. PLANET’S SURFACE - CONTINUOUS A range of mountains takes form in the haze. Moving closer. The mountains are piles of TRASH. The entire surface is nothing but waste. “,..We're gonna find adventure in the evening air...” A silhouetted city in the distance. What looks like skyscrapers turns into trash. Thousands of neatly stacked CUBES OF TRASH, stories high. Rows and rows of stacked cubes, like city avenues. They go on for miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “,..Beneath your parasol the world is all a smile...” Something moving on the ground far below. A figure at the foot of a trash heap. A SMALL SERVICE ROBOT diligently cubing trash. Rusted, ancient. Cute. Every inch of him engineered for trash compacting. Mini-shovel hands collect junk. Scoop it into his open chassis. His front plate closes slowly, compressing waste. A faded label on his corroded chest plate: “Waste Allocation Loader - Earth Class” (WALLY) Wally spits out a cube of trash. Stacks it with the others.  Something catches his eye. Tugs on a piece of metal stuck in the stack. A hubcap. The sun reflects off it. Wally checks the sky.

dialogues.speaker: ON TRASH HEAP HORIZON
dialogues.text: The sun sets through the smoggy haze. ”“,..And we won’t come back until we’ve kissed a girl --" He places the hubcap in his compactor. Presses a button on his chest. The song stops playing. The end of a work day. Wally attaches a lunch cooler to his back. Whistles for his pet COCKROACH. The insect hops on his shoulder. They motor down from the top of a GIANT TRASH TOWER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wally travels alone. Traverses miles of desolate waste. Oblivious to roving storms of toxic weather. Passes haunting structures buried within the trash. Buildings, highways, entire cities... Everything branded with the SAME COMPANY LOGO. “Buy N Large” “BNL” stores, restaurants, banks...transportation! The corporation ran every aspect of life. There’s even a BNL LOGO on Wally’s chest plate. CLOSE ON NEWSPAPER Wally drives over. Headline: “TOO MUCH TRASH!! Earth Covered!!” The deck: “BNL CEO Declares Global Emergency!” A photo of the BNL CEO giving a weak smile. Wally’s old treads are threadbare. Practically falling apart. Cause a bumpy ride for his cockroach. He passes the remains of other RUSTED WALL-E UNITS. Fancies one with NEWER TREADS than his own...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wally now sports the newer treads. Rolls past a SERIES OF HOLOGRAPHIC BILLBOARDS. The solar-powered ads still activate when he passes them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Ad #1: BNL logo over trash) Too much garbage in your face? (Ad #2: starliner in space) There's plenty of space out in space! (Ad #3: starliners take off from Earth) BNL starliners leaving each day. (Ad #4: WALL-E units wave goodbye) We'll clean up the mess while you’re away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wally drives down a deserted overpass. Activates an even LARGER HOLOGRAPHIC BILLBOARD.

dialogues.speaker: BILLBOARD AD
dialogues.text: Shows off a CITY-SIZED LUXURY STARLINER. Depicts passengers enjoying all its amenities.

dialogues.speaker: BILLBOARD ANNOUNCER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The jewel of the BNL fleet: “The Axiom”. Spend your five year cruise in style. Waited on 24 hours a day by our fully automated crew, while your Captain and Autopilot chart a course for non-stop entertainment, fine dining. And with our all-access hover chairs, even Grandma can join the fun! There’s no need to walk! “The Axiom”. Putting the “star” in Executive Starliner. The BNL CEO appears at the end. Waves goodbye as the Axiom takes off.

dialogues.speaker: BUY N LARGE CEO
dialogues.text: Because, at BNL, space is the final “fun”- tier. The holographic billboard powers off. Reveals the AXIOM’S DESERTED LAUNCHPAD in the distance. The mammoth structure sits across the bay. Now empty and dry. A polluted, dead valley.

dialogues.speaker: ON COLLAPSED BRIDGE RAMP
dialogues.text: Near its edge rests a WALL-E UNIT TRANSPORT TRUCK. A giant child’s Tonka Truck left to weather the elements. A “Buy N Large” logo on its side. Wally approaches the rear of the truck.  Pulls on a lever. The back lowers. Wally motors up the ramp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open racks for storing WALL-Es line both walls. KNICKKNACKS OF FOUND JUNK littered everywhere. The tired robot removes his newfound treads. Ahh... Home. Wally motors down the center aisle. Flicks on an ancient BETAMAX PLAYER. Jury-rigged to an iPod. Pushes in a cassette labeled, “Hello Dolly!” The image is very poor quality. Actors sing and dance to Put On Your Sunday Clothes (POYS The same song Wally worked to.

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: [Hums POYSC] Wally opens his cooler. Newfound knickknacks. Pulls out the hubcap from his chest. Looks back at the TV. Mimics the dancers on the screen. Pretends the hubcap is a hat. Continues to unpack: A spork. A Rubik's Cube (unsolved). A Zippo Lighter. He presses a BUTTON by the rack of shelves. They rotate until an empty space appears. His new items are lovingly added to the shelf. The Zippo joins a pre-existing LIGHTER COLLECTION. A new song, It Only Takes A Moment, plays on the video. Wally is drawn to it. Presses his “Record” button.

dialogues.speaker: ON TV SCREEN
dialogues.text: Two lovers sing gently to one another. They kiss...hold hands... Wally tilts his head as he watches. Curious. Holds his own hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wally motors outside. Turns over his Igloo cooler to clean it out. Pauses to take in the night sky. STARS struggle to be seen through the polluted haze. Wally presses the “Play” button on his chest. The newly sampled It Only Takes A Moment (IOTAM) plays. The wind picks up. A WARNING LIGHT sounds on Wally’s chest. He looks out into the night. A RAGING SANDSTORM approaches off the bay... Unfazed, Wally heads back in the truck. IOTAM still gently playing. ...The massive wave of sand roars closer... Wally raises the door. Pauses. WHISTLES for his cockroach to come inside. The door shuts just as the storm hits. Obliterates everything in view. INT. TRUCK — SAME Wally alone in the center of his shelter. Unwraps a BNL SPONGECAKE (think Twinkie). Lays it out for the cockroach to sleep in. It happily dives in. Wally collapses himself into a storable cube. Backs into an empty shelf space. Rocks it like a cradle... ...and shuts down for the night. Outside the wind howls like the Hounds of Hell. INT. WALLY’S TRUCK - NEXT MORNING Wally’s CHARGE METER flashes “WARNING”. He wakes. Unboxes. Groggy and lifeless. Stumbles outside. EXT. ROOF OF WALLY’S TRUCK The morning sun. Wally fully exposed in its light. His front panel splayed out like a tanning shield. A solar collector.  His CHARGE METER chimes full. Solar panels fold away into hiding. Wally, now awake, collects his lunch cooler. Heads off to work. --.-and accidentally runs over the cockroach. Horrified, Wally reverses. Reveals the FLATTENED INSECT under his tread. The cockroach simply pops back to life. No biggie. Ready to go. Relieved, Wally resumes their commute. EXT. WALLY’S WORK SITE - THAT MORNING A SERIES OF “WALLY AT WORK” MOMENTS: - CU of Wally’s hands digging into garbage. CU of trash being scooped into his chest compactor. A cube lands by the cockroach. - Wally discovers a BRA in the garbage. Unsure what it’s for. Tries placing it over his eyes, like glasses. Tosses it in his cooler. - Wally finds a set of CAR KEYS. Presses the remote lock. Somewhere in the distance a CAR ALARM CHIRPS. - Plays with a paddle ball. The ball keeps smacking him in the face. He doesn’t like it. - Wally discovers a DIAMOND RING in a JEWEL CASE. Throws out the ring. Keeps the case. The jewel case drops into the cooler, then... .---A RUBBER DUCKY... .-.-A BOBBLE HEAD DOLL... ---An OLD BOOT... ..-A TROPHY... - Wally finds a FIRE EXTINGUISHER. Activates it. FOAM blasts in his face. It's tossed far, far away from his cooler. - Wally’s shovel hand strikes something solid. Faces a REFRIGERATOR much larger than himself. Now what? - CU on fridge door. A WELDING BEAM moves down its center. It emits from between Wally’s SPLIT BINOCULAR EYES.  The door falls apart in two pieces. Reveals... -.-a SMALL PLANT in its early stage of growth. Wally is entranced. Carefully, he extracts the section of earth around it.

dialogues.speaker: IGLOO COOLER
dialogues.text: Wally gently places the plant inside the old boot. Dusts dirt off the leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robot and faithful cockroach return home. Wally stops short of the threshold. Stares at the ground. Continues staring.

dialogues.speaker: A RED DOT
dialogues.text: quivers on the dirt. A single laser point of light. Wally moves to touch it... ---The dot races along the ground. Wally drops his Igloo. Chases after the dot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dot leads Wally deep into the polluted expanse. He is so fixated on it he doesn’t notice

dialogues.speaker: MANY LASER POINTS
dialogues.text: coming from every direction. All racing into the valley over the contour of the terrai Triangulating towards a center. Wally’s dot suddenly stops. Slowly he reaches for it. Can’t grab it. Just light. ALL THE DOTS converge in front of him. The ground shakes. Wally becomes confused. Doesn’t see above him. The SUN growing brighter behind the cloud cover. A noise. Building.  Rocket engines. Wally senses he should look to the sky. Now THREE SUNS are descending on him. Wally runs for it. An enormous COLUMN OF FIRE blocks his path. A second column of fire. A third. Trapped. Wally cubes the ground beneath him. Working fast. Noise deafening. Heat rising. Digs in just as a tide of flame carpets the ground... ..-.Then suddenly quiet. Smoke clears.

dialogues.speaker: THE SCORCHED EARTH
dialogues.text: Wally’s head rises out of the dirt. Glows red hot from the heat. Trembles with fright. Everything in shadow. Something very big looms over him. Wally climbs out of his hole. Bangs his head on metal. WIDE on a massive SPACESHIP. Rests ominously in the empty bay. A PORTAL on its underside opens. Frightened, Wally tries to hide. Nowhere to go. He places a SMALL ROCK on his head. Boxes up. A DEVICE lowers to the ground on a long stem. Scans the surface. Wally creeps closer for a better look. The device unfolds. Wally boxes up again. A CAPSULE descends from a chute in the stem. ROBOT ARMS emerge from the device. Place the capsule on the ground. Press buttons. The capsule falls away in sections, to reveal... -+-a PROBE ROBOT. It hovers gracefully above the ground. White. Egg-shaped.  Blue-lit eyes. Female. Eve. Wally is transfixed. Inches closer. Watches Eve from behind the device. Tilts his head. Time stops. She’s the most beautiful thing he’s ever seen. Eve hovers over the ground. A BLUE RAY emits from her front panel. Fans out 180 degrees. Scans random objects and areas. The device rises back into the ship. Exposes Wally. He rushes for cover behind the nearest rock. Never takes his eyes off Eve. Watches her float away from the ship. ...from the ship? The ship! Engines roar back to life. Wally digging furiously. The rocket takes off. Smoke clears. Again, a red hot Wally peeks out from the ground. Looks for Eve. She is watching the ship rise into the clouds. Waits until it is completely out of sight... ...then Eve rises high up into the air. She flies around the bay. Soars like a graceful bird. Does loops in the sky. Zooms right past Wally’s rock. He is hypnotized. Eve descends gently to the ground... Wally sneaks up closer. Hides behind another boulder. Slips. Makes a NOISE. Instantly, Eve whips around. Her arm converts into a LASER CANNON. Blasts Wally’s boulder to smithereens. ...-Smoke clears...All quiet. Eve, now cold and dangerous.  10. Scans the area. No sign of life. All business again. Hovers away to probe more of the planet.

dialogues.speaker: ON OTHER SIDE OF BOULDER CRATER
dialogues.text: Wally boxed up behind what little remains of the rock. Trembles uncontrollably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve wanders through the pillars of cubed trash. Scans random areas. Wally spies from the shadows. Too frightened to approach. She moves on. He follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve probes a mound of tires. Wally hiding nearby. He flinches at the sight of

dialogues.speaker: HIS COCKROACH
dialogues.text: innocently approaching Eve from behind. She spins around. Blasts the insect. Wally is gut-punched. The cockroach climbs out of the smoking crater. Unscathed. Still curious. Eve finds the insect intriguing. Lowers her arm. The end separates into individual hovering sections... .-.--A HAND. She lets the insect crawl up her arm. Wiggles into her workings. It tickles.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: [Giggles] Wally relaxes. CHUCKLES privately. Eve sonically picks up Wally’s location. Locks onto him.  11. Arm converts to laser cannon. Fires rapidly. Quick glimpses of Wally dodging the blasts. Trash piles are systematically obliterated around him. Wally now exposed. Nowhere to hide. Boxes himself up. Shakes uncontrollably. Eve holds her fire.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (electronic hums) [Identify yourself. ] She slowly approaches Wally’s box. Keeps her gun trained on him.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (electronic hums) [Repeat. Identify yourself. ] Wally peeks out from his box. Doesn't understand a thing she says. Doesn’t care. Can’t believe she’s real. The cockroach climbs down her gun arm. Jumps onto his master. Eve scans Wally. A RED LIGHT appears on her chest. Buzzes “negative”. He’s not what she’s looking for. She retracts her gun arm. Hovers off. Wally watches her go. Lovestruck.

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: [Sigh.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOUIS ARMSTRONG’S “LA VIE EN ROSE” PLAYS Eve scans through the market. Wally follows from a safe distance. A stray puppy-dog. Eve glances over at him. Wally panics. Bumps into a RACK OF SHOPPING CARTS. Creates an avalanche.  12. They chase him down a flight of stairs. Wally reaches the exit doors. Won't open! Carts pig pile on top of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wally perched on the roof. Patiently watches Eve fly. She scans the ground below her, like a searchlight. Eve comes in for a landing below. Shuts down for the night. Wally waits. Quietly sneaks down the refinery fire escape. Accidentally trips. Tumbles to the ground. Eve doesn’t wake. Wally creeps up to her. Opens his arms wide... ...and measures her. Turns to a pile of trash. Splits open his eyes. Begins welding something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve powers up again. Does a double take. A TRASH SCULPTURE OF EVE stands in front of her. She hovers away, unimpressed. Doesn't notice Wally hiding behind a PILE OF PIPES. Wally kicks the pipes in frustration. They roll on top of him.

dialogues.speaker: EVE SEARCHING
dialogues.text: - Scans a car engine. Negative. Slams the hood shut. - Scans a Port-A-Potty. Negative. Slams the door shut. - Scans an Apollo capsule. Negative. Slams the hatch shut. - Scans a FREIGHTER HOLD.  13. Negative. Slams the lid shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve hovers over the freighter. Frustrated. Not finding what she’s looking for. Wally eavesdrops from afar. Eve flies past the ship’s CRANE MAGNET. Gets stuck. Wrestles to free herself. Furious, she BLOWS UP THE ENTIRE SHIP. The reaction startles Wally. Eve slumps down against a dredged anchor. She gives up. Concerned, Wally cautiously approaches. Sits at the other end of the anchor. Both robots stare silently at the fiery wreck. Then... ...Slowly, very slowly, Wally inches towards her. Musters the courage to speak, when -- She suddenly turns to him:

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (hums ) [So what’s your story?] Wally falls backwards with surprise. Me? Eve scrolls through a variety of languages:

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (German) [Directive? ] (Japanese) [Directive? ]

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: [Huh? ]

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (Swahili) [Directive? ] (English) Directive?

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: (beeps ) (Oh, I understand that! ]  14.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Directive? Wally eagerly turns to some nearby trash. Scoops it into his compactor. Proudly spits out a cube. Points to Eve.

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: (struggles to speak) Di...rec...t--

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Directive? Wally nods.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Classified.

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: (beeps ) [Oh. Sorry.] She scans his CHEST LOGO.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Name?

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: (struggles again) W-wally? ...Wally.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (smooth; almost perfect) Wwww-aaaa-leee... Wally nearly melts. She says his name so beautifully. Moves closer.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Wally. (giggles) Eve. Wally tries to repeat it:

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: Eeee...?

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (slower) Eve.  15.

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: Eeeaaah?

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Eeeve. Eeeve.

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: Eee--vah! She giggles again. Wally likes making her giggle.

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: Eee-vah! Ee --

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Eve. The wind kicks up. The WARNING LIGHT sounds on Wally’s chest. He moves to grab her.

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: (Gasp!) Eee-vah!

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (hums ) [Hey watch it! Don’t come any closer! ] She draws her gun on him. Doesn’t understand the danger. The sandstorm rushes up behind her. Too late. Wally collapses into a box. The storm hits full force. Eve is instantly lost, disoriented.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Wally? Wally? WALLY’S HAND appears out of the dust. Calmly takes Eve’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The back door lowers. A rush of wind and sand. Wally pulls Eve inside. Closes the door. She coughs up dust. Wally hits a switch... Strings of CHRISTMAS LIGHTS fill the space. His racks of oddities painted in colored light.  16. An air of enchantment. Eve is taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: (beeps ) [Come on in.] She drifts through the sea of knickknacks. Becomes spooked by a SINGING BILLY BASS FISH. Threatens to shoot it, but Wally calms her down. He is compelled to show her everything. Hands her an eggbeater... ..-bubble wrap (so infectious to pop)... --.a lightbulb (lights when she holds it)... ...the Rubik’s Cube (she solves it immediately)... ---his Hello Dolly tape. Curious, she begins unspooling the tape.

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: (loud beeps) [My tape!!] He grabs it back. Protective. Inserts it carefully into the VCR. Please still work. The movie eventually appears on the TV. Plays a clip of PoYSc. Wally is relieved.

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: (beeps ) [What do you think?] Mimics the dancing for Eve. Encourages her to try. She clumsily hops up and down. Makes dents in the floor. Rattles everything. Wally politely stops her.

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: (beeps ) [How ‘bout we try a different move?] Spins in a circle. Arms out. Eve copies. Spins faster, and faster... Too fast. Accidentally strikes Wally. He flies into the shelves. Eve helps him up from the mess. Wally’s LEFT BINOCULAR EYE falls off. Dangles from two wires. Eve GASPS with concern. Wally placates her.  17.

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: (beeps ) [It’s fine. ] Feels his way to the rack of shelves. Rotates them until... .-..-SPARE WALL-E PARTS appear. Replaces his broken eye with a new one. Eve is relieved. She eyes his LIGHTER COLLECTION. Flicks open a Zippo. Ignites a FLAME. Wally freezes. He had no idea it could do that. Moves closer to inspect it...

dialogues.speaker: ON WALLY
dialogues.text: It’s the closest he’s ever been to Eve. She remains focused on the lighter. Wally stares up at her. --.The tiny flame flickering between them... .-.The Hello Dolly video plays IOTAM in the background... Suddenly, he is moved to express his love. Musters the courage to open his fingers... ...Timidly reaches his hand out to hers... -- Eve turns and looks at him. Wally instantly chokes. Pulls his hand back. Eve becomes intrigued with the TV. Scans the image of the lovers singing IOTAM... Wally watches her. His infatuation still palpable. Then he remembers...

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: Ee-vah! He rushes to his shelves. Eve watches him rummage through junk. A drum falls down on his head. She giggles, charmed by it all. Something about Wally... She is drawn back to the lovers on TV... ...then the lit Zippo lighter in her hand. A tap on her shoulder. She turns to find Wally holding something. The plant. Eve immediately locks onto it.  18. Drops the lighter. In a flash... ..-her chest opens... a TRACTOR BEAM snatches the plant away... -..stores it inside her... Then she shuts down completely. Only a SINGLE GREEN LIGHT pulsing on her chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wally is stunned. What'd I do? Waves his hand in front of her face.

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: Ee-vah? Knocks on her chest plate. No response. Wally panics. Gently shakes her.

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: Ee-vah? Still no response.

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: Ee-vah? ...Ee-vah?! CAMERA MOVES IN on the blinking green light...

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: EXT. ROOF OF WALLY’S TRUCK - DAY The morning sun. Wally places Eve in his charging spot. Aims her hovering form to face the sun. Waits.

dialogues.speaker: WALLY TRYING TO REVIVE EVE
dialogues.text: - Several hot days pass with Wally holding vigil in the h - A THUNDERSTORM approaches on the horizon. Wally holds an UMBRELLA over Eve. Gets struck by lightning. Holds up another umbrella. Gets struck again. - A SANDSTORM blows through. Wally pops out of a dune on the truck’s roof. Lifts up an UPSIDE-DOWN BARREL that protected Eve.  - Wally pries open a panel on Eve’s chest. Reveals her pulsing BLUE HEART-BATTERY. Attaches JUMPER CABLES to his own HEART-BATTERY. Tries to connect the other end to hers. An automatic defense system blows him off truck. - Wally & cockroach take Eve for a walk. Pull her along on a LEASH OF CHRISTMAS LIGHTS. - Wally gives Eve a boat ride on a LAKE OF SLUDGE. Uses an industrial tire as a boat. Rows like a gondolier with a road sign. - Wally sits by the empty bay with Eve. Watches the SUNSET. Burns “WALL-E + EVE” on a public trash can. Tries to pull out her hand to hold it. It snaps back into place, trapping his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. ROOF OF WALLY’S TRUCK - NIGHT Wally has set up the TV on the roof. The blank Eve floating next to him. Tries unsuccessfully to play PONG with her. Still no response. Finally, he gives up.

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: [defeated sigh] EXT. TRUCK —- NEXT MORNING Wally loads up his cooler. Checks on Eve one more time. Still nothing... Heads off to work, defeated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wally simply going through the motions. No spirit in him at all. Stops. Pulls out the Zippo lighter. Flicks it a few times. A RUSH OF WIND blows out the flame. Distant rumbling. Wally looks in the direction of his home. A BRIGHT GLOW is lowering down through the clouds.  20.

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: (beeps ) [Oh no.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wally racing as fast as he can. The cockroach clings onto him for dear life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RECON SPACESHIP towers over his truck. A ROBOT ARM cherry-picks Eve from the roof. Lifts her up and into the ship’s cargo hold. Wally racing in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: EE-VAH
dialogues.text: Reaches the end of the collapsed bridge ramp. Forced to watch Eve disappear into the ship. The cargo doors slam shut. The first of the THREE ROCKET ENGINES powers up. Wally heads down a hill of rubble to the ship. Notices his cockroach tagging along behind him. Leads it back to the top of the hill.

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: (beeps ) [Stay.] The insect mopes. Droops its little antennae. Wally motors back down to the rocket...

dialogues.speaker: BASE OF RECON SHIP
dialogues.text: The engines blast a WALL OF SMOKE. Preparation for launch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve is secured into a slot. Joins a ROW OF OTHER EVE PROBES. All dormant. Only Eve flashes a GREEN LIGHT. The CAMERA DRIFTS BACK out a window...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...where Wally steadily climbs up the side. The ship’s engines ignite. Wally clamps his hands tight to a metal support. The rocket takes off into space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cockroach watches his master go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The spaceship roars through the sky. Wally tightens his grip, battling the G’s. He looks ahead. SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: HUNDREDS OF BNL SATELLITES
dialogues.text: litter the outer atmosphere. The ship bursts through the layer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The recon ship breaks free of the planet. Its boosters shut down. Wally takes in the sudden QUIETNESS OF SPACE. Looks back at his planet.

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: Oooh... Weightlessness takes effect. Wally almost floats away. Grabs hold of the ship. Knocks on a WINDOW near Eve.

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: E-vah! No response. She remains shut down. Wally points out at the stars. It is the most spectacular light show possible. And Wally has a front row seat.

dialogues.speaker: CELESTIAL SPECTACLES
dialogues.text: - The ship flies past the MOON. A BILLBOARD stands next to the abandoned APOLLO MOON ROVE “BNL Outlet Coming Soon.” - The ship passes by the SUN. Wally pops open his solar panels.  22. Instantly recharges. - The ship cruises alongside SATURN'S OUTER RINGS. Wally runs his hand through the tiny particles of ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DUMBBELL NEBULA slowly twists in space. Wally is mesmerized by it. Leads his eye to a LIGHT, growing in the distance ahead. A planet? No. A starliner. Gigantic in size. The “AXIOM”. The now tiny recon ship heads straight for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO TUG-ROCKETS guide the ship in. It locks into GIANT BRACES fixed on the deck. The impact knocks Wally off. He lands in the scaffolding of the front brace. Suddenly the entire dock comes to life. Robotic arms and service robots of all types appear. -.-Rise from the floor... .-Lower from the ceiling... It's a cacophony of automation. They all attend to the ship.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: and four other probes slide out of the ship’s side. Suspended in a horizontal rack. Wally is surprised to find her facing him. She remains shut down. Just a few feet away with a giant abyss between them.

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: Ee-vah... ? A SQUAD OF CLEANER ROBOTS emerge onto the dock. A small roller BRUSH-BOT (M-O) leads.

dialogues.speaker: M-O
dialogues.text: (beeps ) [Hold up. ]  23. Waits for the FLOOR LINES to appear. Depict their exact path of action.

dialogues.speaker: M-O
dialogues.text: (beeps ) [Okay. Go.] They file out on the line. A crane-bot lowers Eve from the rack. M-O and his cleaning crew stand ready. M-O scans Eve. ON M-O’S DISPLAY POV Scan reads: “%16 Foreign Contaminant.” M-O is disgusted. Revs his brush roller. Moves in for the clean. A VACU-BOT follows after him. Then a SPRAY-BOT and BUFFER-BOT finish off. The cleaning crew waits for probe #2. Wally studies the routine. Figures out a way to climb down to Eve. When the crane returns, Wally poses as probe #3. The crane grabs him instead. M-O turns around to clean the next probe. Wally is lowered in front of him. Boxes up. Confused, M-O scans him. ON M-O’S DISPLAY POV Scan reads: “%100 Foreign Contaminant.” M-O is horrified by such filth. A RED SIREN LIGHT rises from his head.

dialogues.speaker: M-O
dialogues.text: [Oh, no, no, no. This is all wrong. ] He scrubs Wally full force. Wally’s front panel pushes him away. Confused, M-O moves to clean him again. Wally backs away. Leaves a DIRT TRAIL. M-O curses:

dialogues.speaker: M-O
dialogues.text: [You made the floor all dirty! Stop it!]  24. M-O furiously scrubs the floor. Wally peeks out, amused by this neurotic little guy.

dialogues.speaker: ON FAR WALL
dialogues.text: Two STEWARD ROBOTS come out of the wall. Act like hovering caution signs. A small robot (GOPHER) shoots out a PNEUMATIC TUBE. He bears epaulet like shoulders and a siren for a face. Gopher beeps an ELECTRONIC ORDER for the Stewards to foll

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON M-O AND WALLY
dialogues.text: M-O just finishes cleaning the floor. Wally is fascinated. Impishly makes another mark. M-O compulsively cleans it. Can’t resist.

dialogues.speaker: M-O
dialogues.text: [Look, it stays clean. You got that?] Wally wipes the bottom of his tread on M-O’s face. M-O loses it. Scrubs his own face. Gopher and his steward escort arrive. The cleaning crew stand at attention. Wally boxes back up with the probes. Gopher begins scanning each probe. Moves down the line. Scans Wally...moves on to the next probe... Stops -- Wait a minute. Turns back. Wally is gone. Gopher shrugs it off. Proceeds... Reaches Eve. Doesn't notice Wally hidden behind her. Gopher scans her BLINKING PLANT LIGHT -- The entire dock goes to “Code Green”! Alarms sound. Green lights flash. All automation stops. In rapid succession... ...A HOVER-TRANSPORT glides up to Gopher... A crane-bot loads Eve... Curved energy bands lock her down... ...-Gopher assumes the driver’s seat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s all moving too fast for Wally. Suddenly Eve’s transport heads for the ELEVATOR.  25.

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: Ee-vah! Wally chases after them. Grabs onto the back of the transport. They disappear into the elevator. The cleaning crew files out. Follow their lines back to their hold. M-O stops short. Notices Wally’s FILTHY TRACKS crossing his path.

dialogues.speaker: ON M-O'S DISPLAY
dialogues.text: Reads: “FOREIGN CONTAMINANT” The tracks lead to the elevator. M-O’s neurosis takes over. Must clean dirt. He makes a radical decision and... --.jJumps off his line. Starts methodically cleaning the dirt trail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gopher waits patiently as the floors pass. Wally hidden behind the transport. Peeks at Eve. Pets her blank faceplate.

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: (quiet beeps) [It’ll be okay, Eve.] The ELEVATOR DOORS suddenly open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOZENS OF ROBOTS speed along a multi-lane passageway. All following glowing lines on the floor. Wally’s head whipsaws back and forth. Tries to process it all. Doesn't notice Gopher’s transport merge into traffic... ..-without him! Wally shrinks from the high-speed traffic. Timidly attempts to merge. Sticks out one tread... -- Instantly causes a ROBOT PILE-UP. Wally boxes up. Guns it. Weaves across all the lines on the floor. Bounces off robots like bumper cars.  26. Barely able to navigate the chaos. Takes refuge in the middle of an INTERSECTION. Scans for Eve... ON WALLY’S POV DISPLAY ...a PAINT-BOT paints a wall sign... A GARBAGE-BOT dumps trash into a wall chute... ...-Down the hall, Eve’s transport glides up a ramp...

dialogues.speaker: EE-VAH
dialogues.text: Wally chases after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wally flies up the ramp. Nearly collides with a merging HOVER CHAIR. It blocks his way. Wally gains alongside it, and discovers

dialogues.speaker: A HUMAN PASSENGER
dialogues.text: sitting, reclined, in the chair. He is large, round and soft - like a big baby. Wears a red, BNL jumpsuit. The chair seems to be steering itself. Guided by floor lines, just like the robots. Speaker headrests block his peripheral vision. A HOLOGRAPHIC SCREEN floats inches in front of his face. He converses with a SECOND PASSENGER on screen:

dialogues.speaker: PASSENGER
dialogues.text: Well, I’ve been in my cabin all morning so let’s hover over to the driving range and hit a few virtual balls into space.

dialogues.speaker: PASSENGER
dialogues.text: Nah, we did that yesterday. I don’t want to do that.

dialogues.speaker: PASSENGER
dialogues.text: Well then what do you want to do?

dialogues.speaker: ON WALLY
dialogues.text: He looks over his shoulder. Passenger #2 is floating right next to them. Isolated in his own hover chair. Also in a red jumpsuit. Also a big baby.  27.

dialogues.speaker: PASSENGER
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Something. Both humans are totally unaware of the other’s presence. They all exit the hallway. Merge into the...

dialogues.speaker: ECONOMY CLASS COURTYARD
dialogues.text: Wally is in awe. Hundreds of floors of GUEST ROOMS rise on all sides. THOUSANDS OF PASSENGERS fill the giant space. All reclined and riding on hover chairs. MULTIPLE FLOOR LINES guide their chairs in all directions Humans have become the most extreme form of couch potatoe Absolutely no reason to ever get up. No purpose. Every one of them engrossed in their video screens. Cocooned in virtual worlds. Over-developed fingers tap ARMREST KEYPADS. The controls allow them to steer... -order food... play games... -..-and most of all...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...CHAT MINDLESSLY with other passengers: The CHATTER is deafening. No one notices Wally at all. He drives into the endless human traffic.

dialogues.speaker: MISC. FEMALE PASSENGER
dialogues.text: Bot, over here! A DRINK-BOT floats over to a passenger. Puts a fresh drink in her open hand. Wally flows with the traffic into a LARGE TUNNEL.

dialogues.speaker: MISC. PASSENGERS
dialogues.text: I can’t hear you...I’m in a tunnel. You're breaking up...Oh, okay. You're back. I can hear you now... They spill out into the BRIGHT LIGHT of the

dialogues.speaker: MAIN CONCOURSE, (COACH CLASS)
dialogues.text: A city-sized, mall-like environment. All under a GIANT DOME. The ceiling simulates the sun and sky. A BNL LOGO (w/ time & temp) appears on the FACE OF THE SU  28.

dialogues.speaker: SHIP'S COMPUTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Buy N Large. Everything you need to be happy. Your day is very important to us. Wally is gobsmacked. A PASSENGER (JOHN) hovers up alongside him. Tries to hand off his empty drink cup to Wally.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Hey, Drink-bot. Wally shies away. John reaches farther out with the cup.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Here, take the cup. Take the cup -- Whoa! Reaches too far. John falls to the floor. Flails like an upside down turtle. Unable to stand on his baby legs. Instantly, SIRENS. Wally watches TWO STEWARDS arrive. Block John’s accident. EMERGENCY LINES appear on the floor. Redirect the hover chair traffic. John reaches out for assistance. Nobody notices. Just drive past.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Stewards? Hello? Uhh, help.

dialogues.speaker: STEWARD
dialogues.text: Please remain stationary. A service-bot will be here to assist you momentarily. Suddenly John begins to rise.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Uhh...Hey! What’s going on? Wally lifting him up from behind. Loads him back onto his chair. John doesn’t know how to react. Wally waves hello.

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: Wally!

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Uhh... John.  29.

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: Ee-vah?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Uh no, John. Wally scans the concourse. Spots Eve’s transport about to board a MONORAIL. He races after them. Abandons the stunned John.

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: Ee-vah!

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (small wave) Bye...Wally.

dialogues.speaker: ON MONORAIL
dialogues.text: It pulls out of the station. Wally leaps on. Barely catches the last car. It glides down the concourse. INT. “ALL DAY” CARE CENTER A NANNY-BOT supervises a group of TODDLERS. All wearing matching BNL ONESIES. Motionless in their HOVER RINGS. They stare at educational programming on their holo-scree

dialogues.speaker: NANNY-BOT
dialogues.text: “A”! “A” is for “Axiom”, your home sweet home. “B”! “B” is for “Buy N Large”, your very best friend...

dialogues.speaker: OUT THE WINDOW
dialogues.text: Wally’s monorail glides past.

dialogues.speaker: ON MONORAIL
dialogues.text: Wally takes in the overstimulating scenery. Dozens of THEMED FOOD RESTAURANTS whizz by. Each specialty is served in the same JUMBO PLASTIC CUP.

dialogues.speaker: SHIP'S COMPUTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Mmmmm! Time for lunch in a cup. Wally now notices his fellow passengers. They all slurp from similar cups.  30. Next, the monorail passes a BEAUTY SALON. BEAUTICIAN-BOTS primp and style passengers.

dialogues.speaker: SHIP'S COMPUTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Feel beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: BEAUTICIAN-BOTS
dialogues.text: (pre-recorded lines) -..It’s the new you...Oh stunning...You look great...I know honey...Ahh. Men... They pass through the FASHION DISTRICT. ENORMOUS BILLBOARDS hawk the latest color schemes.

dialogues.speaker: SHIP'S COMPUTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Attention, Axiom shoppers. Try blue! It’s the new red!

dialogues.speaker: MONORAIL PASSENGERS
dialogues.text: Oooohh... Passengers next to Wally press their chair buttons. Their JUMPSUITS change from RED TO BLUE.

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: Whoa. Their monorail speeds into a glass tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE TUNNEL
dialogues.text: Wally looks past a PASSENGER (MARY) next to him. Spots Eve on the other side. Wally tries to sneak behind Mary. But her chair moves backwards. Smashes Wally against the back wall. No way getting past her. Wally politely tries to get Mary’s attention. She’s oblivious. Chats incessantly on her holo-screen:

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Date?! (derisive snort) Don't get me started! Every holo-date I've been on has been a virtual disaster! If I could just meet one who wasn't so superficial. There are no good men out there!... Wally tries to fold back her speaker headrest. Accidentally breaks it off.

dialogues.speaker: MARY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ..-I know! I know ‘cause I've scrolled through them all -- (Gasp) What the --?  Mary's chair shorts out. ..-holo-screen shuts off... --.jJumpsuit defaults back to red... For the first time Mary has an unobstructed view. Her eyes slowly dilate. It's as if she’s seeing the world for the first time..

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (mesmerized) Huh... ? Her gaze falls on Wally. He waves politely.

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: Wally.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (beat) M-mary.

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: Ee-vah. He points to Eve on the other side of Mary. Gestures he'd like to get by. She is slow to understand.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Huh? Oh, uh, sure go ahead. Mary moves her hover chair back. Wally rolls over to Eve. Pats her protectively.

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: Ee-vah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The monorail emerges into “First Class.” A vast, circular plaza of pools. Surrounded by a ring of high rise apartments. Hundreds of passengers lounge poolside. All serviced by their personal UMBRELLA-BOTS.

dialogues.speaker: POOLSIDE PASSENGER
dialogues.text: (claps; umbrella-bot opens) Shade.

dialogues.speaker: ON MONORAIL
dialogues.text: It stops at the BRIDGE PLAZA. 31.  32. The base of the Axiom’s Bridge Tower. The passengers exit. Follow their respective lines. Gopher drives Eve (and Wally) towards the tower. Pass over a GIANT BNL LOGO on the plaza floor.

dialogues.speaker: ON MARY
dialogues.text: She is the last to exit the car. Doesn't follow any lines. Excited by her newfound awareness. Looks out on the Lido Deck as the monorail pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I didn’t know we had a pool!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve's transport enters the cavernous hall. A lone TYPING-BOT is stationed at the far end. A bridge elevator behind him. Blocked by a force field gate. The transport pulls up to the typing-bot. Gopher BEEPS. The typing-bot responds by typing. Slowly. One...button...at...a...time... Finally, the gate lowers. Elevator doors open. The typing-bot watches the transport enter the elevator. Notices Wally hiding at the back. Wally gives it a FRIENDLY WAVE as the doors close. The elevator shoots up to the bridge. The typing-bot looks at its hand. Mimics Wally’s waving gesture. Huh. Never done that before. Tries it some more...

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE ELEVATOR
dialogues.text: Wally looks out on the descending Lido Deck. Marvels at it all. His view suddenly goes dark. The elevator doors open on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The large circular room is dimly lit. Windows to SPACE on one side, a LIDO DECK view on the oth A massive console wraps around its entirety. Covered in buttons. A sea of thinking lights.  33. A CAPTAIN'S WHEEL automatically steers. Gopher drives into the middle of the room. Beeps. Suddenly the wheel disengages. The autopilot (AUTO). A single camera eye lights up its center. A periscope stem connects Auto to the ceiling. Slides along rails up to Gopher, who salutes. Auto eyes Eve. Scans her. Wally sneaks back into the shadows. Auto detects Eve’s plant light. Goes still... Begins computing rapidly. The number “A113” flashes on his lens. An ELECTRONIC EXCHANGE begins between Auto and Gopher. Wally watches the interchange. Nervous. Without warning, Auto heads in his direction. Wally boxes up. A CIRCULAR SECTION OF FLOOR lights directly below him. Irises open, like a trapdoor. Wally drops...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -..and hits the floor hard in the room below. Someone stirs, then resumes SNORING. Auto lowers through the portal. A CLOCK ALARM BUZZER activates.

dialogues.speaker: AUTOPILOT
dialogues.text: Captain. You are needed on the bridge. Shoots back up. The portal closes. Wally peeks out of his box. ON WALLY’S POV PAN across the nautical-themed cabin. One wall lined with PORTRAITS OF FORMER CAPTAINS. Their years of service listed below. The autopilot in the background of each picture. Each generation of Captain more devolved than the other. From human to gelatinous blob. We stop on the FINAL PORTRAIT. A blobby Captain. It looms above the actual CAPTAIN, snoring in bed. He reaches out in his sleep to quiet the snooze alarm. Smacks Wally’s box by mistake.  34. Activates the POYSC SAMPLE. It plays loud. The Captain sits straight up, half-awake:

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: -- All hands on deck!! Wally is frantic to turn off the music as... ...PREP ROBOTS burst from the cabinetry... a BEAUTICIAN-BOT, MASSAGE-BOT and WARDROBE-BOT... The Captain’s bed automatically raises... ...Forms into a hover chair... The robots rapidly massage, brush, primp and dress him.

dialogues.speaker: BEAUTICIAN-BOT
dialogues.text: (pre-recorded) Morning! Just a trim? Wally blends in with the primping. Uselessly wiggles the Captain’s toes.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: (Giggles) Lines light on the floor. Lead his chair automatically to the elevator. Wally sneaks aboard just as the doors close.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Elevator doors swish open. The Captain still half-asleep. Claps his hands twice. On cue, a COFFEE MAKER rises from the console. Pours a cup. CLASSICAL MUSIC PLAYS on overhead speakers. The Captain’s chair links with a LIT FLOOR PATH. Leads him over to the coffee. Wally stays lockstep behind him. Auto glides over to the Captain.

dialogues.speaker: AUTOPILOT
dialogues.text: Sir --

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Coffee. Wally hides under the console just in time. The Captain reaches for his coffee. Makes a minimal effort. Easier to adjust his chairback slowly forward... .-.--almost there...and...he grabs the coffee.  35.

dialogues.speaker: AUTOPILOT
dialogues.text: Sir, the annual -- The Captain gives Auto the hand. Sips his coffee.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Protocol, Auto. First things first. (to the room) Computer, status report. His chair automatically arcs along the console. SPECIFIC PANELS light up as he passes. CAPTAIN SHIP’S COMPUTER (sips coffee) Unchanged. ..unchanged... Mechanical systems?...Reactor unchanged...unchanged... core temperature?...Passenger unchanged...unchanged... count?...Regenerative food unchanged... buffet?...Jacuzzi Ph balance... Atmospheric conditions...laundry service volume...

dialogues.speaker: ON WALLY
dialogues.text: He eyes Eve on the transport across the room. Has to get to her. But Auto is right above him. Can’t move.

dialogues.speaker: AUTOPILOT
dialogues.text: Captain... Auto calls up a screen on the console. Displays the recon-ship and a flashing positive probe. Waits patiently for the Captain to notice. Finally, the Captain turns...

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Okay, Auto.

dialogues.speaker: AUTOPILOT
dialogues.text: Sir, the annual reconnaissance has -- ..-but then notices the time.

(disappointed sigh) Auto, why didn’t you wake me for the morning announcements? He slingshots his chair to the Lido Deck side of the brid Wally nearly collides with him.  36. Ducks back under the console.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Honestly, it’s the one thing I get to do on this ship. Grabs a large dial. TIME OF DAY ICONS surround it. Cranks it from mid-day back to sunrise.

dialogues.speaker: OUT ON LIDO DECK
dialogues.text: - The FAKE NOON SUN reverses at high speed to a SUNRISE. - Passengers’ LUNCH CUPS switch to BREAKFAST CUPS. - Poolside passengers’ umbrella-bots close up. An ANNOUNCEMENT WHISTLE BLOWS over the intercom. A SECTION OF SKY DOME becomes a JUMBOTRON SCREEN. Displays a live video feed of the Captain. The image also shows up on every passenger’s CHAIR SCREEN

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN, (ON INTERCOM)
dialogues.text: (unmotivated) Well, good morning everybody, and welcome to day 255,642 aboard the Axiom. As always, weather’s a balmy 72 degrees and sunny, and -- Oh, hey, I see the ship’s log is showing that today is our 700th anniversary of our five year cruise. Well, I’m sure our forefathers would be proud to know that 700 years later we'd be... (deflates) ..-doing the exact same thing...they were doing... Cut to VARIOUS ASPECTS OF AXIOM LIVING. The listening passengers look just as bored as the Captai

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN, (INTERCOM)
dialogues.text: (snaps out of ennui) SO! Be sure next mealtime to ask for your free... (hard to pronounce) ...septuacentennial cupcake -- in a cup. Also today we have, uh...uh...Hey, Auto, what’s that flashing button? (mic feedback whine)

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON THE BRIDGE
dialogues.text: The Captain stares at a FLASHING BUTTON on the console. It bears the same PLANT ICON as Eve’s display.  37.

dialogues.speaker: AUTOPILOT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Captain? The Captain turns to Auto. For the first time he notices Eve. Finally. Auto hovers over her. Salutes.

dialogues.speaker: AUTOPILOT
dialogues.text: Probe One has returned positive.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Positive? Auto re-activates Eve. She wakes. Rises to salute the Captain. Across the room, Wally watches with sheer joy. She’s okay! He is compelled to head straight for her...

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: But...no probe’s ever come back positive... (looks at flashing button) ..-before. The flashing button is practically calling to him. Can’t resist. Presses it. Instantly SHADES close on all the windows. The room goes dark. ...Wally is forced to hide under the console again... A LARGE HOLO-SCREEN appears right above him. Pre-recorded footage of the BNL CEO plays:

dialogues.speaker: BUY N LARGE CEO
dialogues.text: Greetings and congratulations, Captain! If you're seeing this, that means your Extraterrestrial Vegetation Evaluator, or... (air quotes) ..."EVE” probe, has returned from Earth with a confirmed specimen of ongoing photosynthesis! The Captain stares slack-jawed at the screen. Wally sneaks under the console towards Eve...

dialogues.speaker: BUY N LARGE CEO
dialogues.text: That's right, it means it’s time to go back home!  38.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: (nervous ) Home? W-w-we'’re going back?

dialogues.speaker: BUY N LARGE CEO
dialogues.text: Now that Earth has been restored to a life-sustaining status, by golly, we can begin “Operation Recolonize”! A section of the console illuminates. An ancient, dusty MANUAL slides out... ...into a passing Wally’s hands. Wally immediately boxes up. Holds the manual over his head. The Captain mistakes Wally for a book podium. Grabs the manual. Blows dust off the cover. It reads: “OPERATION RECOLONIZE”. Below the title, the same PLANT ICON from Eve’s display.

dialogues.speaker: BUY N LARGE CEO
dialogues.text: Simply follow this manual’s instructions to place the plant in your ship’s holo- detector, and the -- (bad edit) -- Axiom -- will immediately navigate your return to Earth! It’s that easy!

dialogues.speaker: ON VIDEO SCREEN, (DURING SPEECH)
dialogues.text: An animated diagram depicts a stage below the ship’s brid The symbol of a HOLO-DETECTOR rises up. A STICK FIGURE places a plant inside the machine. A STARLINER ICON flies back towards Earth. The Captain listens closely to the instructions. Wally paying attention as well.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN WALLY
dialogues.text: Huh? Huh? Wally notices he has a clear shot to Eve. Heads in her direction.

dialogues.speaker: BUY N LARGE CEO
dialogues.text: Now, due to the effects of micro-gravity, you and your passengers may have suffered some slight bone loss. But I’m sure a few laps around your ship’s jogging track will get you back in shape in no time. The Captain looks at his VESTIGIAL LEGS.  39.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: We have a jogging track?

dialogues.speaker: BUY N LARGE CEO
dialogues.text: If you have any further questions just consult your operation manual. See you back home real soon. The transmission ends. The Captain examines the manual. Holds it out in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: (reads; to himself) Operate... Manuel... (aloud; cautious) Manuel, relay instructions. Manuel? Auto intervenes. Clips the corner of the cover with his handle... ...and simply opens the book. The Captain is both fascinated and intimidated. Lifts the cover with his own fingers.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Wow... Will you look at that?

dialogues.speaker: ON EVE
dialogues.text: Wally taps her shoulder. Not now Wally -- Double take!

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Wally?!

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: (tiny wave) Ee-vah! Eve is in a state of disbelief. Shoves Wally into the shadows under the console.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (hushed; angry) (Wally, what are you doing here?! You can’t be here! You’re going to get me in trouble!...] Makes a flurry of clandestine gestures at him. Wally just stares at her. Smitten.  40.

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: (swoons ) Ee-vah...

dialogues.speaker: ON THE CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: He manages to turn to the FIRST PAGE OF INSTRUCTIONS.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: (reads aloud) Well, let’s open her up. Step One. Voice command, “Confirm Acquisition.”

dialogues.speaker: SHIP'S COMPUTER
dialogues.text: Confirm Acquisition. The bridge suddenly jumps to life. Green lights flash. A LARGE DEVICE appears from the ceiling... -..Scans the entire room... Identifies Eve... Rides along the ceiling rails... Stations itself directly above Eve... Arms unfold. Position her... ...A VOICE ARM swings into the Captain’s face:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHIP’S COMPUTER Voice authorization required.

dialogues.speaker: SHIP'S COMPUTER
dialogues.text: Accepted. A BUTTON-PUSHING ARM lowers. Presses a sequence of buttons on Eve... Her chest lights up. The doors open. The Captain winces... .--.and nothing is inside.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Where’s the thingie?

dialogues.speaker: AUTOPILOT
dialogues.text: Plant.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Plant. Right. Right. Where is it? (checks manual) Maybe we missed a step. Show me how you change the text again...  4l. Auto and the Captain turn away. Re-read the manual. Eve is stunned. Searches her chest cavity for the plant. Then she remembers...

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Plant! Wally... (turns on him) Wally! Wally flinches. Surprised by her anger. Eve opens Wally’s chest. Empty. Picks him up. Scans the floor. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: Ee-vah?

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (angry electronics) [Find it!] PLANT! Wally scared of her. Starts searching.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Why don’t you scan her to be sure. Eve jumps back to attention. Auto slides up to her. Scans her chest cavity.

dialogues.speaker: AUTOPILOT
dialogues.text: Contains no specimen. Probe’s memory is faulty.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: So, then...we’re NOT going to Earth?

dialogues.speaker: AUTOPILOT
dialogues.text: (shakes his wheel) Negative.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: So, uh, I guess things go back to normal, huh?

dialogues.speaker: AUTOPILOT
dialogues.text: Correct, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: (privately relieved) Well, false alarm!  42.

dialogues.speaker: SHIP'S COMPUTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: False alarm. Instantly the plant retrieval device retracts. Exits back into the ceiling. The shades rise. Lights go back on.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: The probe must be defective. Gopher, send her to the Repair Ward. Eve turns. Excuse me? Gopher hops to attention. Traps Eve in his SUSPENSION BEAM. Loads her back onto the transport...

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Have them run diagnostics on her. Make sure she’s not malfunctioning -- EEYAH!! ...and reveals WALLY. Everyone stares at him. Long awkward pause. Wally innocently motors over to the Captain. Shakes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: Wally. Leaves a CLUMP OF DIRT in his palm. The Captain stares at it. Turns to Auto.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Have “Wally” cleaned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator opens. Gopher’s transport drives out. Both Eve and Wally strapped on it with energy bands. The typing-bot has now mastered waving. Waves an enthusiastic goodbye. Wally tries to get Eve’s attention.

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: Ee-vah? She gives him the cold shoulder. Refuses to speak to him. Wally shrinks.  43. The transport exits the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Analyze. The CLUMP OF DIRT is suspended in a beam of light. It rotates. The captain sits at his vanity console. ANALYSIS DATA scrolls on a HOLO-SCREEN.

dialogues.speaker: SHIP'S COMPUTER
dialogues.text: Analysis: foreign contaminant. Substance is a three phase system composed of various combinations of naturally derived solids. Subject is most commonly referred to as “soil”, “dirt”, or “earth”. The last word piques his interest.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Earth? His eyes drift to a GLOBE on his shelf.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Define “Earth”...

dialogues.speaker: SHIP'S COMPUTER
dialogues.text: “Earth” - the surface of the world as distinct from the sky or sea. Dozens of IMAGES OF LAND pop up on screen. Lush, green, colorful, inviting. He's fascinated. Takes it all in.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Wow... Define “sea”.

dialogues.speaker: SHIP'S COMPUTER
dialogues.text: “Sea”... EXT. AXIOM/CAPTAIN’S QUARTERS - SAME THROUGH THE WINDOW we see the Captain. Glued to his screen. Filled with ocean images.

dialogues.speaker: SHIP'S COMPUTER
dialogues.text: .»..an expanse of salt water that covers most of the Earth’s surface and surrounds its land masses... The CAMERA DRIFTS AWAY from the window... Moves aft to the Axiom’s stern... +..Pushes in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M-O continues to clean WALLY’S FILTHY TRAIL. Oblivious to everything around him. Cuts through traffic. Robots crash into each other in his wake. M-O doesn’t notice EVE AND WALLY’S TRANSPORT drive past. They hover down a corridor, and enter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a fully automated clinic for broken bots. Day care for the malfunctioned. The REJECTS are kept in FORCE FIELD PENS. Dozens line the walls. Eve and Wally stop at the INSPECTION STATION. Robotic ORDERLY-ARMS activate. Wally shrinks. Watches them systematically check in Eve. Perform an I.D. scan. Attach a RED “DEFECT” BOOT to her head. A button is pressed on the boot. Eve goes into “sleep” mode. Lifted off the transport.

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: (beeps ) [Where are you going?! The orderly-arms now start on Wally. He escapes before they can place a defect boot on him. Races through the ward. Wally runs smack into a defective BEAUTICIAN-BOT.

dialogues.speaker: BEAUTICIAN-BOT
dialogues.text: (pre-recorded) Just a trim? Uh huh. She paints Wally’s face with hideous looking make-up. Holds up a mirror. Wally gasps.  45.

dialogues.speaker: BEAUTICIAN-BOT
dialogues.text: You look gorgeous. Wally is snatched up by an orderly-arm. Placed in an empty force field pen. Sits between a PAINT-BOT and VACU-BOT: The broken paint-bot flings paint at Wally... ...The vacu-bot sneezes dust in his face... Across the way a MASSAGE-BOT flails wildly. Orderly-arms restrain him with an ENERGY STRAIGHTJACKET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve slides past Wally. Carried by an orderly-arm. Brought into the “DIAGNOSTICS” ROOM. The frosted glass doors shut.

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: Ee-vah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orderly-arms run diagnostics on a few reject robots: - An UMBRELLA-BOT flips open and overextends. The orderly-arms struggle to close it. - A DEFIBRILLATOR-BOT shocks a CRASH-TEST-DUMMY. It bursts into flames. Eve is awoken from “sleep” mode. A series of tests begin. Eve is annoyed but calm. It’s all routine. An orderly-arm easily detaches her gun arm.

dialogues.speaker: OUT IN THE REPAIR WARD
dialogues.text: Wally stares at the frosted glass doors. Can only make out EVE’S SILHOUETTE. To him, her arm is being ripped off.

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: Ee-vah!

dialogues.speaker: BACK INSIDE WITH EVE
dialogues.text: The orderly-arm tests Eve’s circuitry. Her insides light up. It tickles.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (Giggles)  46. Next to her the UMBRELLA-BOT’s mechanism SCREECHES.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE WITH WALLY
dialogues.text: Wally watches in horror. It looks as if Eve is being tortured. Mistakes the screeching for her screams. Wally struggles to free himself.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE WITH EVE
dialogues.text: She is washed and scrubbed. A CIRCULAR BUFFER cleans between her head and body. It feels good.

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON WALLY
dialogues.text: It looks as if Eve is being beheaded. He needs to stop the torture. Wally fires his CUTTING LASER at his pen’s force field. The barrier shorts out. Wally tumbles to the floor. Lands on his “Play” button. Poysc blares across the ward. The Rejects all stop and stare.

dialogues.speaker: EEEEEEVAAAAHH
dialogues.text: Wally races to the diagnostics room. Crashes right through the glass doors. Finds Eve surrounded by orderly-arms. Grabs Eve’s separated gun arm. Points it at the orderly-arms.

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: (angry beeps) [Let her go, or I'll shoot! ] His hands tremble, Don Knotts-style. Doesn't realize... ---he’s holding the gun backwards. Eve slowly reaches for the weapon.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: ("Put the gun down...”) Wally... An orderly lunges at him. Wally panics. Shoots! The gun fires backwards. It blasts through the repair ward.  47. Blows up the REPAIR WARD CONTROL PANEL. Wally shrinks. He knows he’s in trouble.

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: The smoking remains of the control panel SHORT CIRCUIT. +.-All orderly-arms go limp... The repair ward doors open up... ...-and all FORCE FIELDS disappear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Rejects look at each other for a beat. Then CHEER wildly. We're free! The mob of robots all rush Wally. Lift him on their shoulders. Carry their hero out of the ward. Wally still holding on to Eve’s gun arm. Eve watches in astonishment. This day just gets worse and worse. She flies off after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rejects march Wally out the entrance. Their RED “DEFECT” BOOTS all blink. Activate a WARNING LIGHT above the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EMERGENCY LIGHTS blinking. Activate an embedded ROW OF STEWARDS. They pop out of the wall. Race to the repair ward. Sirens wailing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The REJECT MOB stampedes through the halls. Disrupts all robot traffic. Wally carried over their heads. Suddenly, the mob stops in front of...  48. -+-a BLOCKADE OF STEWARDS.

dialogues.speaker: STEWARD
dialogues.text: Halt. Wally’s dropped in front of them. Still holds Eve’s gun. Cowers. A TINY ROBOT pushes Wally closer. Show ‘em who’s boss.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (stern) Wally! Eve catches up to them. Flies over to Wally. Snatches her arm back. Just as she reattaches her gun... ..-The steward CAMERA EYES take a snapshot of them.

dialogues.speaker: ALL AROUND THE SHIP
dialogues.text: Alarms sound. SCREENS appear, displaying EVE AND WALLY’S IMAGE. She appears to brandish her gun at camera. Like Bonnie and Clyde. Their faces now on every wall... ...-passenger’s hover chair... cabin... hallway...

dialogues.speaker: SHIP'S COMPUTER
dialogues.text: Caution: Rogue robots...Caution: Rogue robots...

dialogues.speaker: BACK WITH EVE AND WALLY
dialogues.text: The stewards prepare to fire SUSPENSION BEAMS (like Gophe Eve realizes what’s about to happen. Grabs Wally. Flies over the stewards.

dialogues.speaker: STEWARDS
dialogues.text: Halt. Halt. The mass of rejects take their cue. Robot rebellion! They bust through the steward blockade.

dialogues.speaker: ON VARIOUS HALLWAYS
dialogues.text: Robots recognize Eve and Wally as they fly past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Match them with the “Wanted” screens. Call attention to them. Point. Stewards in hot pursuit. Eve hides herself and Wally in a PORTHOLE CUBBY. Lets the stewards pass by. She glances out the porthole... ON EVE’S POV She can see the DOCKING BAY below her. Just under the bay doors... ...a row of EMERGENCY ESCAPE PODS. Eve gets an idea. Grabs Wally and flies down the hallway...

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE AXIOM ELEVATOR
dialogues.text: Eve and Wally ride in uncomfortable silence. Their “WANTED” IMAGE plays on an elevator screen.

dialogues.speaker: SHIP'S COMPUTER, (SCREEN)
dialogues.text: Caution: Rogue robots. Wally points to it.

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: (beeps ) [Hey look! We’re on TV -- !] Eve aims her gun at the screen. Blows it to pieces. Wally shrinks into a box. Never mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark. The elevator chimes. Eve and Wally step out. Rows of NUMBERED BAY DOORS line the hallway. Eve approaches “Bay #1”. She and Wally enter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve navigates the dark. Approaches a freestanding CONSOLE. Fiddles with some buttons.  50.

dialogues.speaker: ON WALLY
dialogues.text: He glances down at EVE’S HAND. Privately intertwines his fingers. Maybe now is the right moment...

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: (quiet) Ee-vah...?

dialogues.speaker: FLASH
dialogues.text: Banks of controls light up around them.

dialogues.speaker: AN ESCAPE POD
dialogues.text: is revealed at the end of the room. Its hatch automatically opens. Bathes the room with light from its lit interior. Eve turns to Wally:

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Earth. She points to an OVERHEAD SCREEN. It displays coordinates to Earth.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Earth. She gestures for Wally to enter the pod. He happily complies. Jumps up on one of the seats. Pats the seat next to him. Aren't you coming? Eve remains at the threshold. Shakes her head. Points to her chest. Makes her PLANT SYMBOL glow.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Directive. ...She’s not going. This changes everything. Wally races out of the pod. Boxes up.

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: (beeps ) [Then I’m not going either. ] Eve shakes her head.  51.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (gentle, but firm) Wally. Carries his box back into the pod. Exits. Wally follows her right back out. Drives behind the console. You can’t make me. Eve sighs.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (frustrated) Wally. The hallway elevator CHIMES. They both look up. Someone is coming. Eve shuts off everything. Lights go out. The pod closes back up. Both Eve and Wally hug the wall. Blend in with the other wall fixtures. They HEAR something hover into the room. Can’t see what it is. Then... An EPAULET ROBOT ARM rises up over the console. Presses buttons. The pod lights up again. The hatch opens. The stranger’s SHADOW comes around the console to reveal.

dialogues.speaker: GOPHER
dialogues.text: Eve and Wally look at each other. Gopher? They watch from the shadows as... ---Gopher enters the pod... -..-opens his chest cavity... -..emits his suspension beam... --.and deposits the PLANT.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (excited whisper) Plant! Gopher exits the pod.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: She keeps her eyes on Gopher. Watches him return to the console. She turns to speak to Wally --  52. He's gone.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (whisper ) Wally? Wally is inside the pod. Picks up the plant. Proudly shows it to Eve.

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: (loud whisper) Ee-vah!

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (louder whisper) Wally! Too late. Gopher hits a button. The pod door shuts on Wally... ...-and launches into space. Gopher shuts off the room. Exits. Eve leaps out of the shadows. Looks out the POD BAY WINDOW. Wally’s pod rapidly shrinking in the distance. The plant icon on Eve’s chest glows. She rushes to a narrow SERVICE AIRLOCK. Enters it like a phone booth.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE AIRLOCK
dialogues.text: Eve bursts out into space. Rockets after Wally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wally plastered against the back of the pod. It suddenly reduces speed.

dialogues.speaker: SHIP'S COMPUTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Cruising speed. He drops to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: SHIP'S COMPUTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You are now free to move around the cabin.  53. Wally fumbles to get his bearings. Peers out the rear hatch window. Sees the Axiom receding from view.

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: (beeps ) [Yikes!] He clambers up into the pilot’s seat. Pulls back hard on the throttle. Nothing happens. Looks down at the console. A SELF-DESTRUCT DIAL is counting down:

dialogues.speaker: SHIP'S COMPUTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Twenty seconds till self-destruct... Uh oh. Wally frantically hits the SELF-DESTRUCT button. No change. Pushes every button on the console. Everything activates: Lights flash... .-.-Oxygen masks drop...

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE POD
dialogues.text: ...Windshield wipers activate... Flares fire off... -..-Parachutes deploy...

dialogues.speaker: SHIP'S COMPUTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Ten seconds till self-destruct... Wally panics. Looks for a means of escape. Spots the hatch. Grabs the pod’s FIRE EXTINGUISHER. Shoots himself to the door.

dialogues.speaker: SHIP'S COMPUTER
dialogues.text: Ten, nine, eight, seven, six, five, four, three, two... Pulls on the EMERGENCY EXIT LEVER. The hatch won’t open!

dialogues.speaker: ON EVE
dialogues.text: She races through space after him. Suddenly, in the distance, the POD EXPLODES.  54. Eve is gut-punched.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: No, no, no... She flies towards the debris field, when -- Wally whizzes right past her.

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: Ee-vaaaaaah! He holds the FIRE EXTINGUISHER. Uses it as a form of propulsion. Eve is consumed with relief. Chases after him.

dialogues.speaker: ON WALLY
dialogues.text: He points the extinguisher the other way. Attempts to fly back over to her. It’s hard to steer... ...-They rocket right past each other again...

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: (beeps ) [Stay there! I’1l come to you!] Eve waits. Wally finally has the hang of steering. Fires short bursts. Very slowly...makes his way...to Eve. Gets extinguisher foam in her face. She giggles.

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: ("Look what I’ve got”) Ee-vah... He opens his compactor door. Pulls out the PLANT, still in the boot.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (Gasp!) ON EVE’S DISPLAY POV .-..Sensors zero in on the plant... Confirm its authenticity... A MAP OF THE AXIOM appears... Draws directions to the bridge... .-.-A command flashes: “DELIVER TO AXIOM SUPERIOR”...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve is ecstatic. She snaps the plant up with her tractor beam. Seals it safely in her chest. Then scoops up Wally in her arms. Spins him around.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Wally! (Laughs) Wally can’t believe his luck. Rests his head on her shoulder. Bliss. Eve stops spinning. Leans her head against his. A tiny ARC OF ELECTRICITY passes between them. A “thank you” kiss. Wally’s METER spikes. He floats circles in space.

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: (swoons )

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (hums ) [Come on. Time’s a wastin’.] She reaches for his hand. Wally shakes his head. Holds up his extinguisher instead.

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: (beeps ) [I can fly myself.] Kicks on the extinguisher. Spins in a pirouette... .-..and flies away. Eve giggles. Chases after him. BING CROSBY'S “STARDUST” PLAYS The two fly around the stern of the ship. Wally does a few barrel rolls.

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: (beeps ) (Try that.] Eve giggles. Matches him move for move.  56. The pair fly between the BOOSTER ENGINES of the ship. Weave in and out of the rocket flames. Bank up along the ship’s port side. Execute a double helix in perfect unison... INT. AXIOM’S OBSERVATION DECK - SAME Passengers hover down the hallway. All focused on their private screens. No one looks out at the stars. -..except for MARY. She has pulled over to the side. Stares wistfully out the DECK WINDOW.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (sigh) So many stars. Spots EVE & WALLY dancing among the stars.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Oooh... (recognizes Wally) Hey, that’s what’s his name -- She backs up to wave hello. Bumps into JOHN’S HOVER CHAIR.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Hey! What the -- Mary leans over to his armrest. Turns off his holo-screen. Points out the window.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Look! Look at THAT!

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (disoriented) Wha...huh? Wally flies past the window. A wave of recognition hits John. He comes to life, as if wakened from a long sleep.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Hey... I know that guy! It’s, uh... (snaps fingers) Wally! Hey Wally! It’s your buddy, John!  57.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Right, Wally! Hi Wally! They both wave until Wally’s out of sight. John absentmindedly lowers his hand to his armrest... -.--and touches Mary’s hand. Both turn towards each other. They make eye contact for the first time. Awkward beat.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE WITH WALLY AND EVE
dialogues.text: They soar across the Axiom’s bow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Auto busy operating the ship. Doesn't see Eve and Wally outside the window. Auto turns the SKY DIAL from DAY TO NIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CONCOURSE
dialogues.text: The sky dome fast-forwards to evening. PAN OVER to the top of the bridge tower. The windows of the Captain’s quarters are dark. Only the FLICKERING GLOW OF A HOLO-SCREEN lights the room

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Define “hoe-down”.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain is still engrossed in his Earth research. MULTIPLE IMAGES litter the screen. Crops, farms, a barn, etc.... An IMAGE OF PEOPLE SQUARE DANCING pops up.

dialogues.speaker: SHIP'S COMPUTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: “Hoedown” - a social gathering at which lively dancing would take place. An aperture opens in the ceiling above. Auto lowers down to face the Captain.  58.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Auto! Earth is amazing! (points to images) These are called “farms”. Humans would put seeds in the ground, pour water on them, and they’d grow food, like, pizza -- Auto shuts off the holo-screen.

dialogues.speaker: AUTOPILOT
dialogues.text: Good night, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: (annoyed grunt) Auto rises back up to the bridge. The aperture shuts. Lights out. The Captain glares at the ceiling. Then whispers conspiratorially to the computer.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Psst! Computer. (the holo-screen lights up) Define “dancing”.

dialogues.speaker: BACK OUTSIDE THE AXIOM
dialogues.text: Eve and Wally descend along the starboard side. Spiral gracefully around one another.

dialogues.speaker: SHIP'S COMPUTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: “Dancing” - A series of movements, involving two partners, where speed and rhythm match harmoniously with music. Wally’s extinguisher runs out of foam. He lets it float freely out into space. Eve catches him in her arms. Wally croons.

dialogues.speaker: SONG ENDS
dialogues.text: Eve scans the Axiom for a way in. Notices SPARKS. Down on the ship’s lower hull...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A REPAIR-BOT (BURN-E) welds an antenna. Eve and Wally fly into the open hatch behind him. It shuts. Burn-e bangs on the closed door. Stuck outside.  59.

dialogues.speaker: BURN-E
dialogues.text: (beeps ) [Hey! Let me in! Let me in!] (looks around) [Crap.]

dialogues.speaker: SHIP'S COMPUTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The Lido Deck is now closing...The Lido Deck is now closing. The last few passengers exit the pool area. All wearing the same color blue uniforms... -..except TWO RED ONES still in the pool.

dialogues.speaker: FEET
dialogues.text: They ripple the surface of the pool. John and Mary float over the water’s surface. Splash one another playfully.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Hey now. Stop that...

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Make me (giggles).

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I didn’t know we had a pool. A LIFEGUARD-BOT (glorified megaphone) lowers from its tow Reprimands them from the pool’s edge:

dialogues.speaker: LIFEGUARD-BOT
dialogues.text: No splashing, no diving.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (annoyed) Ahh! Go on! John splashes the robot. It shorts out.

dialogues.speaker: ON UPPER DECK
dialogues.text: Eve and Wally sneak onto the deck. Hide between a ROW OF TOWEL CARTS. Eve peeks through the towels. Surprised to discover TWO STEWARDS. On duty in front of the bridge lobby entrance. No way in.  A TRASH-BOT passes. Dumps its load down a nearby TRASH CHUTE. Eve keys in on the chute. It runs all the way up the tower... ...to the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: ON WALLY
dialogues.text: He stares at EVE’S HAND. Time to seize the moment. Hits the PLAY BUTTON on his chest. It Only Takes a Moment plays from his scratchy speaker. Puts his hands together... Eve whips around. What’s that noise?! Wally holds his hands up to Eve...

dialogues.speaker: WALLY
dialogues.text: E-vah -- Eve immediately shuts off his music. Shoves his hands down.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: (hushed hums) [Stop it! They’1ll hear us!] She places a stack of towels on his head. Gestures for Wally to stay put. Points to her PLANT LIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Directive. Before Wally can even protest she is gone. Zooms silently across the Lido Deck. Up into the trash chute.

dialogues.speaker: EARTH
dialogues.text: It sits in space. The AXIOM glides towards it. Something’s not right. We reveal the CAPTAIN'S FINGERS holding the ship... INT. CAPTAIN’S QUARTERS - SAME The Captain sits by his window to space. Holds a toy AXIOM MODEL over his GLOBE OF EARTH. 60.  61.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: [Rocket noises] Prepare for landing... [Landing noises] We’re here everybody! Yeah, Captain! [crowd cheers] Captain we're home! It’s so beautiful! [crowd cheers]...No it’s nothing. I was pleased to do it. It’s all about you people --

dialogues.speaker: ON TRASH CAN
dialogues.text: NOISES. Eve bursts out from it, like an angel. Blows the lid off. The Captain is stunned by this vision. She opens her chest to reveal... -.-the plant.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: (amazed) How...? How’d you find it?! Eve hovers over to him. Salutes. Formally presents him the plant. He takes it in his hands. Still potted in the old boot. Gazes at it in wonder.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: We can go back home...for the first time! (laughs) What’s it like now? Eve shrugs. Doesn’t know how to answer.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: No, no! Don’t tell me! I want to see for myself! He turns to his console. Hits a button. A CYLINDRICAL DEVICE rises from a panel. The Captain sticks it to the side of Eve’s head. A HOLOGRAPHIC SCREEN projects from the device. Plays back images of her time on Earth. A COLLAGE OF IMAGES rapidly scroll past. All displayed from Eve's POV: ...-Being delivered to Earth... Flying above the devastated landscape... Blowing up a rock... -..Scans of numerous trash locations...

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Wait...that doesn’t look like Earth... Where’s the blue sky... He looks over to his computer screen. The BEAUTY IMAGES OF EARTH still on display. Compares them with what plays on Eve's screen.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: ...Where’s the grass? His face drops. Slumps in defeat. The dream is over. ON EVE’S HOLOGRAPHIC SCREEN The HELLO DOLLY clip of POYSC plays... It stirs the Captain out of his funk. He looks up at the screen. Leans in for a closer look.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: .-.-I know that song... (observes the dancers’ feet) And they're... dancing. Yes, dancing! A rueful smile grows on his face. He looks down at

dialogues.speaker: HIS FOOT
dialogues.text: It’s tapping in time to the music. His gaze drifts over to the plant in his hands. He lifts it up. Makes the boot dance.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: +.+.-You made it somehow, eh little guy? You didn’t give up, did you? As if in response, the plant wilts slightly. A leaf drops.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
